text: <@UC2A2ARPT> Thanks! I do dig this; It is inspiring. <@UFPRPSA4S> I made something related:

elements.text: Thanks! I do dig this; It is inspiring.

text:
<@UFPRPSA4S> I like how tangibly the two boxes are "the same": they hold the exact same thing visually, even small readjustments of the contents via the mouse are reflected in both. They are two different boxes in two different places on the screen, but they are made the same by their contents. The boxes are like variables in that they hold a symbolic/formal thing, but that symbol also has a visual relationship to the box unlike a variable.

Its also cool that you can take the contents out of the box and put it in the other box. The interaction where the x is cropped in one box and comes out of the other box that you are interacting with is great.

elements.text:

They are two different boxes in two different places on the screen, but they are made the same by their contents. The boxes are like variables in that they hold a symbolic/formal thing, but that symbol also has a visual relationship to the box unlike a variable.

Its also cool that you can take the contents out of the box and put it in the other box. The interaction where the x is cropped in one box and comes out of the other box that you are interacting with is great.
